required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness and Possible Complications of Core Needle Biopsy of Orbital Tumors
clinical_study.source: The S.N. Fyodorov Eye Microsurgery State Institution

oversight_info.authority: Russia: Ministry of Health of the Russian Federation

brief_summary.textblock: Core needle biopsy of orbital mass lesions with a semiautomated needles is a safe procedure that provides a sufficient amount of tissue material for standard histological and immunohistochemical analysis and can be an alternative or supplement to fine needle aspiration biopsy

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic

primary_outcome.measure: true identification of an orbital tumor with a core needle biopsy

arm_group.description: semi automated core needle biopsy of the orbital tumors

intervention.intervention_name: semi automated core needle biopsy of orbital tumors

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- unresectable mass lesions with diffuse involvement of the orbit or the tumors with infiltrative growth and indistinct borders which needed to have morphologic verification
Exclusion Criteria:
- An anti-coagulant therapy at the time of biopsy,
- bleeding diathesis,
- suspected hypervascular lesions,
- orbital roof destruction with a tumor,
- apical location of the tumor

facility.name: The S.Fyodorov Eye Microsurgery Federal State Institution

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The S.N. Fyodorov Eye Microsurgery State Institution
responsible_party.investigator_title: MD, PhD, head ocular oncology department
